properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wet weekend in store. Rain will persist over the Great Northern Peninsula today through Saturday and into Sunday. Total rainfall accumulations could exceed 50 millimeters for some areas by the time the rain tapers to showers on Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-21T21:20:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T13:21:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3830001648.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wet weekend in store. Rain will become heavy at times over southeastern Labrador overnight tonight into Saturday morning. The rain will persist into Sunday afternoon before tapering off to drizzle and showers. Total rainfall amounts between 50 and 80 millimeters are possible by the time the rain tapers off. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-21T21:21:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T13:22:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2015794729.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system will continue to bring periods of rain to west-central regions. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 80 mm are expected. The heaviest rain will end on Friday. Local accumulations could approach 100 mm in the Kananaskis and Bow Valley region. An area of heavy rain is moving into the region this evening and will remain through much of the night. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Be prepared for possible winter conditions at higher elevations. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-21T20:33:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T04:34:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1707228388.2019

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds gusting to 80 km/h in the Wreckhouse area will further increase this afternoon, with gusts reaching up to 110 km/h. Winds are expected to diminish on Saturday morning as they begin to shift to southwesterly. ### Very strong winds may push your vehicle around especially on roads through mountain passes and along deep valleys. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-22T05:19:23-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A low pressure system will slowly cross Nova Scotia today and pass to the northeast of the province on Saturday. Rain ahead of this system will weaken this morning across the province, but it will reintensify during the afternoon and evening. The rain will then taper to showers tonight and Saturday. Total rainfall amounts of around 50 mm are forecast, except in areas of heaviest rain, where amounts will be higher. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T02:35:02-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and reduced visibility at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-22T02:24:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-21T10:25:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3277209123.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will continue tonight over portions of Icefield Parkway Highway 93. Local snowfall amounts of 25 cm have already fallen along sections of the highway. An additional 5 cm is expected for the Icefield Parkway before the snow tapers off this morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system will continue to bring rain. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 80 mm are expected with local accumulations possibly exceeding 100 in the Bow Valley region. Rain will end by the afternoon in Jasper and Nordegg and this evening along the southern foothills and in Calgary. Rain in Calgary will vary significantly with this event. Radar estimates show close to 50 mm of rain has occurred over the northwestern sections of the city while the southeast is closer to 10 mm. Rain continues over the northwest while the southeast is currently unlikely to see warning criteria rainfall with this event. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Be prepared for possible winter conditions at higher elevations. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A slow moving low pressure system in Montana will drift into southern Saskatchewan later today. This weather disturbance will bring further rainfall to southern Saskatchewan today and tonight. The Assiniboia region as well as the Shaunavon region east of highway 37 are likely to see a further 30 to 40 mm of rainfall today but local amounts of 50 mm are possible. Thunderstorms are also expected in southwestern Saskatchewan today. Total rainfall amounts could be 20 to 40 mm in some slow moving thunderstorms. The rainfall will push northward tonight and Saturday will remain generally showery throughout southern Saskatchewan. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T08:15:45-00:00
